text:
The challenge that we
had was that our SaaS
provided observability platform

really didn't provide a hundred
percent workload coverage.

We really wanted to move to
something that could provide

seamless coverage across
all of our systems,

whether it's EKS, whether
it's EC2, or Lambda.
So we implemented the AWS Distribution

of OpenTelemetry across all
of our services.

That runs as an agent on those
services, on those resources,

and collects all the spans
from all of the requests,

all the activity, all the
workloads that happen on it.

It collects metrics out of those
spans, the rate, the error,
the duration of all requests that come

through every service,
and it forwards those to
Amazon Managed Service for Prometheus

or AMP. It doesn't matter
if it's on EKS or Lambda

or EC2, it reduces a significant
cognitive load on the
developers when there's a problem

because they go to one
place, it all looks the same.

Out of the 350,000 spans
per second that we do,

it's consuming all of
those metrics off of all
of those spans seamlessly.

It was very easy to install
and update and manage,
and it's reduced a lot of work on my team.

And we had a 40% cost
reduction in this space for us,

which has really freed
up a lot of funds for us
to go tackle other things.

For us, moving to managed
services is really

reducing the cognitive
load on my team as well
as all the undifferentiated heavy lifting

and allows us to really focus
on more innovative solutions.
And we get to go play and have fun

and really enjoy the work
that we do as engineers.
